sentences.sentence: The Swallow( 燕子 ) and the Crow( 乌鸦 )
A swallow( 燕子 ) and a crow( 乌鸦 ) were arguing about  whose feathers( 羽毛 ) were better.
The crow( 乌鸦 ) ended the argument by saying,
“Your feathers( 羽毛 ) are all very well in the spring, but mine protect me against  the winter.”
MORAL: It is in bad times that you find out  who your real friends are.
The Thief( 小偷 ) and His Mother
A schoolboy( 男学生 ) stole a book from one of his classmates, and brought it home to his mother.
Instead of  punishing him, she encouraged him to do it again.
Over time the boy, now a grown man, began to steal things of greater value.
At last, he was caught and taken away to be punished.
As he was being led away, his mother fell to her knees( 跪下 ), crying.
A neighbor seeing this, said to her,
“It is too late for you to cry now.
You should have been as sad as this when he first stole something.”
MORAL: Nip( 扼杀 ) evil( 罪恶 ) in the bud( 萌芽 ).
The Thief( 小偷 ) and the Housedog
A thief( 小偷 ) came in the night to break into a house.
He brought some meat with him to keep the dog quiet, so that he would not wake up( 叫醒 ) his master( 主人 ).
As the thief( 小偷 ) threw him the pieces of meat, the dog said,
“If you think to stop my mouth, you are making a mistake.
This sudden kindness will only make me more careful.
Although you bring me unexpected favors, you are doing this for your own benefit, and to hurt my master( 主人 ).”
MORAL: Don't sacrifice( 舍弃 ) your principles because of a gift.
The Thieves( 小偷 ) and the Rooster( 公鸡 )
Some thieves( 小偷 ) broke into a house, and found nothing worth taking except a rooster( 公鸡 ), which they took away with them.
When they were preparing their meal, one of them caught up( 抓住 ) the rooster( 公鸡 ), and was about to kill it,
when the rooster( 公鸡 ) cried out for mercy( 宽恕 ) and said,
“Please do not kill me: you will find me a most useful bird, for I wake up( 叫醒 ) honest men to their work in the morning by my crowing( 啼叫 ).”
But the thief( 小偷 ) replied angrily,
“Yes, I know you do, making it still harder for us to get our money.
Into the pot( 锅 ) you go!”
MORAL: Don’t expect everyone to appreciate( 欣赏 ) your virtues( 优点 ).
The Tortoise( 乌龟 ) and the Eagle( 鹰 )
A tortoise( 乌龟 ), lazily lying in the sun, complained( 抱怨 ) to the sea birds that no one would teach her to fly.
An eagle( 鹰 ) flying overhead( 在空中 ) heard this and asked her what reward( 报酬 ) she would give him if he would take her up into the sky.
“I will give you anything you want,” she said.
“I will teach you to fly then,” said the eagle( 鹰 ), taking her up to the clouds.
Suddenly the eagle( 鹰 ) let her go, and she fell onto a mountain breaking into pieces.
Just before dying, the tortoise( 乌龟 ) said,
“I can only blame( 责怪 ) myself.
Why did I want to fly in the clouds when I have enough trouble walking on the earth?”
MORAL: Stay with what you know.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事中，雄鹿很自豪自己的角，却看不起自己的脚，当遭遇狮子追赶的时候，他的脚帮助他逃跑，但是他的角卡在树上导致自己的死亡。这个故事告诉我们人们往往会忽视对自己最珍贵的东西。
article_info.share_words: It is in bad times that you find out who your real friends are.   Don’t expect everyone to appreciate your virtues.

question.cn: 在故事The Swallow and the Crow中，谁的羽毛可以在冬天起到保护作用？
question.en: In the story The Swallow and the Crow, whose feather could be a protection in winter?

analysis: 文中提到：“The crow ended the argument by saying, ‘your feather are all very well in the spring, but mine protect me against the winter.’”因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Thief and His Mother，当母亲知道儿子第一次偷东西时，是什么态度？
question.en: In the story The Thief and His Mother, what was the mother's attitude when she knew her son had stolen a book for the first time?

options.en: She asked him to return it.
She encouraged him to do it again.

analysis: 文中提到：“Instead of punishing him, she encouraged him to do it again.”可知，母亲并没有惩罚孩子反而鼓励孩子，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事The Thief and the Housedog 中，为什么小偷会带一些肉？
question.en: In the story The Thief and the Housedog, why did the thief bring some meat with him?

options.en: He wished to keep the dog quiet.

analysis: 文中提到：“He brought some meat with him to keep the dog quiet.”因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Tortoise and the Eagle中，鹰为什么要带乌龟上天？
question.en: In the story The Tortoise and the Eagle, why did the eagle take the tortoise up to the sky?

options.en: The eagle wanted to kill the tortoise.
The tortoise wanted to learn how to fly.
The eagle wanted to play with the tortoise.

analysis: 文中提到：“A tortoise, lazily lying in the sun, complained to the sea bird that no one would teach her to fly. . . ‘I will teach you to fly then.’ said the eagle, taking her up to the clouds.”因此选B。

question.cn: 在故事The Tortoise and the eagle中，乌龟学会了飞翔吗？
question.en: In the story The Tortoise and the eagle, did the tortoise learn how to fly?

analysis: 原文提到：“Suddenly the eagle let her go, and she fell onto a mountain breaking into pieces.”当鹰放手后，乌龟摔到了山上，摔成了碎片，由此可知乌龟并没有学会飞翔，因此选B。
